H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

4.gl: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7854.def: = person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H2401.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H2723.def: = state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

H5383.def: = action with which a person gives money or something of value to another person with the expectation that it will be paid back or returned

H5367.def: = causative action by which humans try to gain control over other humans in an unjust way, ◄ as if they were animals caught in a net or trap

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H962.def: = action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

H3018.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H4229.def: = causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H4229.def: = causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H2143.def: = process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3282.def: = a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H7045.def: = actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H1293.def: = action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H7045.def: = actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H4055.def: = a generic word for clothing, which in certain contexts may denote a specific kind of clothes, such as someone's tunic or armor

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H5844.def: = causative action by which someone puts an object on top of or in front of something else

H2296.def: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6468.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H5287.def: = action by which animals produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H697.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H1290.def: = central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H6685.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H3584.def: = process by which humans lose body volume ◄ as a result of sickness or fasting

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H5844.def: = causative action by which someone puts an object on top of or in front of something else

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H4598.def: = long garment, hanging down to the ankles, ◄ usually made of wool, ► and worn over the {L:tunic<SDBH:כֻּתֹּנֶת>}; it is not clear whether it had sleeves or not, nor whether it was open or closed in the front; ≈ certain attitudes and emotions are often described in terms of such a garment, e.g. "he wore fury like a robe"

2.gl: to be clothed (with a certain state)

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it
